author: gakonst
content:
We had great results on non-EOF JIT FWIW here! https://github.com/paradigmxyz/revmc

Strong NACK from our side on EVM64. I wish that the VM instructions ever were the bottleneck on performance, but it's not.

author: sorpaas
content: Based on your experience, do you think RISC-V will also be of no use (for addressing the bottleneck on performance) or is it totally different?

author: sorpaas
content:
We actually had previously some problems with this approach of JIT, because from what I know LLVM/Cranelift aren't one-pass. So JIT bombs are now possible! (That's why Wasm is also problematic JITing untrusted code.)
Is the benchmarking based on runtime or runtime+compiletime?

author: greystroke
content: Do you believe it would be safe and feasible to decrease the slot time as part of Glamsterdam if EIP-7886 is implemented? There are real (eg. mev reduction, UX improvement, faster time to finality & better L2 intraop) and narrative benefits that slot time decreases address better than gas limit increases.
